Articles.Content:
Is it because they were the same vessel when I launched? Do they both need to be controlled?

Edited October 15, 2016 by regex
I'm fairly sure that rendezvous and docking missions have to be launched separately from Kerbin.

7 minutes ago, regex said:

Is it because they were the same vessel when I launched? Do they both need to be controlled?

Yes, I do believe that they both have to start out as separate launches. The contract text isn't clear but I understand their reasoning. If you could simply undock a lander from your mothership to complete the contract then you didn't really rendezvous and the contract would be easy to cheat.

As for control on both ships - I would assume that to be needed as well. Since they need to be different launches you'll probably need to have it anyway.

Edited October 15, 2016 by HvP

Well that's silly, I just landed half of this thing and did a rendezvous, you'd think we could keep track of state changes or moving out of physics range or something to prevent "undocking a ladder" situations.

E: Probably a bit harsh there. Just disappointed.

Edited October 15, 2016 by regex

Yea. I've been a bit frustrated when I wanted to combine a Mun landing contract with a Mun orbit rendezvous contract, but can't launch them Apollo style and complete both. I'm still waiting for a lot of contract packs to be updated for 1.2 then I can really take advantage of my space program.

Edited October 15, 2016 by HvP
